message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.MM, cs.CE. 

The paper deals with the design of amplify-and-forward (AF) schemes in two-hop one-way relay networks for multigroup multicast transmission, which involves signal processing, information theory, and communication engineering. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) and cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture) are the most likely categories. The paper also proposes a rank-two beamformed Alamouti (BFA) AF scheme, which involves multiple antennas and beamforming, making cs.SI (Signal Processing) a likely category as well. Moreover, the paper formulates the AF design problem as a quadratic program subject to power constraints, which involves optimization and mathematical modeling, making cs.MM (Mathematical Modeling) a possible category. Finally, the paper presents numerical simulations to validate the proposed scheme, which involves performance evaluation and experimentation, making cs.CE (Computational Engineering, Finance, and Science) a possible category.
